io.sphere.sdk.meta

Class ReleaseNotes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.meta.ReleaseNotes

  • public final class ReleaseNotes
extends java.lang.Object

    1.0.0-M9

    • Added Known Issues page.
    • Added experimental support for uploading product images in variants. See ExperimentalProductImageUploadCommand.
    • Added factory methods for Image.
    • Image contains directly getters for width Image.getWidth() and height Image.getHeight().
    • PagedQueryResult is constructable for empty results. Before this, the SDK throwed an Exception.
    • Fields called quantity are now of type long instead of int.
    • Added a documentation page how to construct objects.

    1.0.0-M8

    • Query models contain id, createdAt and lastModifiedAt for predicates and sorting.
    • Introduced endpoints and models for Carts, Customers, CustomerGroups and Orders.
    • Quantity fields are now of type long.
    • Classes like ProductFetchById take now a string parameter for the ID and not an Identifiable.
    • Queries, Fetches, Commands and Searches are only instantiable with an static of method like CategoryCreateCommand.of(io.sphere.sdk.categories.CategoryDraft). The instantiation by constructor is not supported anymore.
    • Enum constant names are only in upper case.

    1.0.0-M7

    • Incompatible change: Classes to create templates for new entries in SPHERE.IO like NewCategory have been renamed to CategoryDraft.
    • Incompatible change: ProductTypeDraft has now only factory methods with an explicit parameter for the attribute declarations to prevent to use the getter ProductTypeDraft.getAttributes() and list add operations.
    • Incompatible change: LocalizedString has been renamed to LocalizedStrings, since it is not a container for one string and a locale, but for multiple strings of different locals. It is like a map.
    • Incompatible change: The Fetch classes have been renamed. From FetchRESOURCEByWhatever to RESOURCEFetchByWhatever
    • Moved Scala and Play clients out of the Git repository to https://github.com/sphereio/sphere-jvm-sdk-scala-add-ons. The artifact ID changed.
    • SphereResources contains now also a listing of queries and commands for the resources.
    • Added ProductProjectionSearch for full-text, filtered and faceted search.
    • Incompatible change: ProductUpdateScope makes it more visible that product update operations can be for only staged or for current and staged. The product update actions will be affected by that.
    • Implemented anonymous carts.

    1.0.0-M6

    • Usage of Java money instead of custom implementation.
    • Introduce ProductProjectionQuery.
    • Introduce QueryDocumentation to document the query API.

    1.0.0-M5

    • Fixed client shutdown problem.
    • Put MetaAttributes in common module and make it an interface.
    • Add ProductProjection.isPublished().
    • Add ProductDiscount models.
    • Add external id fields and methods for categories.
    • Make ProductCatalogData.getCurrent() return an optional ProductData, since current should not be accessible if ProductCatalogData.isPublished() returns false.
    • Make masterVariant in ProductDraftBuilder mandatory.

    1.0.0-M4

    • Replacing joda time library with Java 8 DateTime API.
    • Removing dependency to Google Guava.
    • Rename artifact organization to io.sphere.sdk.jvm.
    • Rename JsonUtils.readObjectFromJsonFileInClasspath to JsonUtils.readObjectFromResource.
    • Reduced the number of SBT modules to speed up travis builds since the resolving of artifacts for every module is slow. In addition fewer JARs needs to be downloaded.
    • Introduced ProductProjections.
    • Javadoc does contain a table of content box for h3 headings.

    1.0.0-M3

    • The query model can now be accessed by it's Query class, e.g., CategoryQuery.model().
    • Added a Getting Started page.
    • Added a Features of the SDK page.
    • Addad a legacy Play Java client for Play Framework 2.2.x.
    • Added PriceBuilder.
    • Further null checks.
    • Add a lot of a Javadoc, in general for the packages.
    • CategoryTree.of(java.util.List) instead of CategoryTreeFactory is to be used for creating a category tree.
    • Move AddressBuilder out of the Address class.
    • Performed a lot of renamings like the requests package to http
    • Moved commands and queries to own packages for easier discovery.
    • Introduced new predicates for inequality like StringQueryModel.isGreaterThanOrEquals(String), StringQueryModel.isNot(String), StringQueryModel.isNotIn(String, String...) or StringQueryModel.isNotPresent().
    • Introduced an unsafe way to create predicates from strings with Predicate.of(String).

    1.0.0-M2

    • With the new reference expansion dsl it is possible to discover and create reference expansion paths for a query.
    • All artifacts have the ivy organization io.sphere.jvmsdk.
    • Migration from Google Guavas com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture to Java 8 CompletableFuture.
    • Removed all Google Guava classes from the public API (internally still used).
    • The logger is more fine granular controllable, for example the logger sphere.products.responses.queries logs only the responses of the queries for products. The trace level logs the JSON of responses and requests as pretty printed JSON.
    • Introduced the class Referenceable which enables to use a model or a reference to a model as parameter, so no direct call of DefaultModel.toReference() is needed anymore for model classes.
    • It is possible to overwrite the error messages of DefaultModelAssert, LocalizedStringsAssert and ReferenceAssert.
    • Versioned contains a type parameter to prevent copy and paste errors.
    • Sorting query model methods have better support in the IDE, important methods are bold.
    • Queries and commands for models are in there own package now and less coupled to the model.
    • The query classes have been refactored.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
